{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mode is a statistical term that refers to the most frequently occurring number found in a set of numbers. It is not related to the arrangement of observations in ascending or descending order, which is the definition of median. It is also not calculated by adding up the values of a group of items and dividing the sum by the number of items, which is the definition of mean. Lastly, it is not necessarily the best measure for central tendency in a highly scented distribution.", "answer_choice": "A"}
